intro: Uloma telfairiae, commonly known as the Florida morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, blue to purple flowers that open in the morning. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms throughout the growing season. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
